materials.raw_text:
P: 32 g (Phosphorus) 
 Se: 16 g (Selenium) 
 Zr: 120 g (Zirconium)

sourcing.instructions:
- Phosphorus can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online retailers specializing in laboratory chemicals. 
 - Selenium can be obtained from chemical suppliers or electronics suppliers as it is used in semiconductor applications. 
 - Zirconium can be acquired from metal suppliers or specialized materials companies.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Measure out 32 g of Phosphorus, 16 g of Selenium, and 120 g of Zirconium using a precise digital scale. 
 2. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, mix the phosphorus and selenium together in a clean, dry container using a glass rod until homogeneously combined. 
 3. Gradually add the zirconium powder to the phosphorus-selenium mixture while continuously stirring to ensure an even distribution of all components.
